intro: Heliotropium neglectum, commonly known as the common heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive white or pale yellow center. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs. Heliotropium neglectum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and waste areas.
